trans-unit.source: Represents a query on an XML document defined by an XPath 1.0 expression.
An XPathMessageFilter uses an XPath expression to determine whether an XML document contains specific elements, attributes, text, or other XML syntactic constructs.
Typically, an application uses an XPathMessageFilter at an endpoint to query the contents of a SOAP message and then takes the appropriate action based on the results of that query.
A queuing process, for example, may use an XPath query to check the priority element of a known header to decide whether to move a message to the front of the queue.
The XML Path Language (XPath) provides a language for addressing parts of an XML document.
The primary syntactic construct in XPath is an expression that defines how to traverse the logical structure of an XML document and address or identify an XPath data type.
Specifically, XPath implementations evaluate an expression against the structure of an XML document to yield one of the four basic XPath data types: strings, numbers, Booleans, and node sets.
They also support functions that convert an XPath data type to a string, number, or Boolean data type.
If a method expects one of these three data types, the result of the expression evaluation is implicitly converted.
Note that these three data types cannot be converted to a node-set type.
The XML Path language is fully described in the [W3C XML Path Language 1.0 specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96179).
Numbers in XPath expressions are expressed as double-precision 64-bit values.
Therefore XPath expressions that involve testing numbers with many significant digits can return incorrect results due to floating point precision issues.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)][XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0, section 3.5](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96180).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class that matches all well-formed XML documents.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter> class with an empty XPath expression.
An empty XPath expression always matches a well-formed XML document, so all objects satisfy the criteria of a filter defined by an empty XPath expression.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class using an XPath expression to specify query criteria for the filter.
Use this constructor when there are no namespaces to manage.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> assigned to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter.Namespaces%2A> property by using the default <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext>, so the XPath expression has access to the function library that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext> defines.
A <xref:System.String> that contains an XPath 1.0 expression.
xpath is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class by reading a streamed XPath with the specified XML reader.
It is assumed that the reader is positioned at the start element of the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The name of the element is not validated before reading.
When this method returns, the reader is positioned immediately after the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The constructor also automatically initializes the namespace manager by resolving all prefixes in the XPath expression as they were bound in the reader.
This method can access any XML that can be created by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter.WriteXPathTo%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the streamed XPath expression.
reader is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class using the specified XPath expression and namespace manager.
Use this constructor when XPath uses prefixes not defined in <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext>, or when you want to use your own <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager>.
An instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageContext> can be created and passed to this method.

If the instances provided to this method are <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext> implementations, it is equivalent to calling the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
An XPath 1.0 expression.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> that resolves any namespace prefixes in `xpath`.
xpath is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class using a specified XPath expression and <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref>.
The XPath 1.0 expression for the filter.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref> that resolves any namespace prefixes, custom functions or variables in `xpath`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class by reading in a streamed XPath with a specified XML reader and using the specified namespace manager.
Use this constructor when you want to use your own <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> to define the filter.
It is assumed that the reader is positioned at the start element of the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The name of the element is not validated before reading.
When this method returns, the reader is positioned immediately after the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the streamed XPath expression.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> that resolves any namespace prefixes in the XPath expression from `reader`.
This can also be an <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref> that defines custom functions or variables.
reader is .
reader is not positioned on the starting element.
An invalid dialect attribute was read: it was not XPath.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> class by reading a streamed XPath with a specified XML reader and using the <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref> to resolve namespaces, custom functions, and variables.
Use this constructor when you want to use your own <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> to define the filter.
It is assumed that the reader is positioned at the start element of the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The name of the element is not validated before reading.
When this method returns, the reader is positioned immediately after the serialized `XPathMessageFilter`.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the streamed XPath expression.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref> that resolves any namespace prefixes, functions, and variables in the XPath expression from `reader`.
reader is .
To be added.
Tests whether a specified message satisfies the criteria of the XPath filter.
This form is not allowed to access the body of the message.
Use the Match method to match elements from the body.
An exception is thrown by this method if the engine attempts to access the message body in order to evaluate the XPath expression.
This helps to ensure that the filter engine does not access the body stream.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> to test.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> satisfies the filter criteria; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
message is .
The XPath evaluation attempted to examine the body of the message.
A compiler error occurred.
Determines whether a buffered message satisfies the query criteria of the XPath filter.
Use this overload of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter.Match%2A> method when a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageBuffer> is available.
This form is allowed to examine the body of the message.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageBuffer> to test.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the Match satisfies the filter criteria; otherwise<xref uid="langword_csharp_ false" name=" false" href=""></xref>.
message is .
A compiler error occurred.
Determines whether the XML document provided by the specified optimized XPath navigator satisfies the query criteria of the XPath filter.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator> class extends the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> class with methods that run queries more efficiently.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator"></xref> that provides data to test.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator"></xref> satisfies the filter criteria; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
navigator is .
A compiler error occurred.
Evaluates the filter over the specified XPath navigator.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> that provides data to test.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data from the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator"></xref> satisfies the filter criteria; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> otherwise.
navigator is .
A compiler error occurred.
Gets the manager that resolves namespace prefixes in the XPath expression that defines the filter.
The Namespaces property can also be an <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext> that defines custom function or variables.
Do not modify the namespace manager instance once the filter is created.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> for the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum number of nodes that should be looked at during filter evaluation.
Some filters can be extremely expensive to evaluate or are very long running.
Because filters operate on XML documents, the best way to set computational limits is to specify the maximum number of nodes that should be looked at during a filter evaluation.
The quota is initially set to <xref:System.Int32>.
The maximum number of nodes that should be looked at during filter evaluation.
The quota is zero or negative.
Gets the schema for the current XML document.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> that represents the current document.
Reads the current XML node.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> used to read the XML document.
reader is .
reader encountered an empty element.
Content of a node is invalid.
Writes a node using writer.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> used to write the node.
writer is .
Initializes the current instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref> with an XPath obtained from a specified XML reader using a specified namespace manager.
The namespace manager instance can be an <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext> that is used to resolve functions and variables.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> used to deserialize the XPath filter.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager> used to manage the namespaces being read from.
Gets the type of XML schema used to serialize the XPath filter.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmLSchemaSet> that contains the cache of XML Schema definition language (XSD) schemas.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmLSchemaType> used to serialize the XPath filter.
schemas is .
An explicit interface implementation that gets the current schema.
The <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> that represents the current document.
An explicit interface implementation that reads the current XML node.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> used to read the XML document.
An explicit interface implementation that writes an XML node using writer.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> used to write the node.
Compacts the XPath filter, which releases all unused memory.
This operation is similar to the resizing of an array so that it has no unused elements.
In all cases.
Serializes the XPath filter to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
The `writer` must be in the *Start* state.
Otherwise an exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> used to serialize the XPath filter.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> used to resolve any namespace conflict for the XPath filter.
Writes the XML XPath element with a specified XML writer.
The `writer` must be in the *Start* state.
Otherwise an exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> used to write the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.XPathMessageFilter"></xref>.
The namespace prefix of the XPath XML element.
The local name of the XPath XML element.
The namespace URI to associate with the XML element.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if namespaces should be serialized out separately as attributes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
localName is .
localName has length = 0.
Gets the XPath expression that defines the query criteria for the filter.
The XPath expression for the filter.
